key_title: Key to the species of Sticherus

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the families of ferns and allied plants
Key to the genera of Gleicheniaceae

source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta)
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J. (1994). Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta). In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Pinnules entire or shallowly crenate-serrate, dull, angled at about 60–90° to axis
Pinnules serrate, shiny, membranous, angled at about 45° to axis (restricted in Victoria to far east)
Pinnules angled at 60–90°, sparsely to densely covered in fine, hair-like scales underneath, margins shallowly crenate to serrate (mainly towards apex of pinnule) or entire
Pinnules angled at about 90° to axis, glabrous underneath, margins entire
Pinnules angled at 45–65°(–75°), narrowly oblong to broadly lanceolate, mostly greater than 20 mm long
Pinnules angled at 75–80°, linear to narrowly lanceolate, less than 20 mm long (restricted to the Otways and Powelltown)
